New Records: Mike Yastrzemski hit a two-run homer in the seventh inning, and Matt Chapman went 3 for 4 with a solo shot, contributing to the Giants' 5-4 victory over the Brewers.
Key Match Events: Mike Yastrzemski's two-run homer in the 7th inning put the Giants ahead for good.
Chapman's solo home run in the fourth tied the game for the Giants.
Chourio's 449-foot homer in the third put the Brewers ahead 2-1.
The Giants' bullpen secured the victory with Camilo Doval retiring Chourio on a fly to deep center in the sixth.
McCray caught a long fly from Rhys Hoskins at the center-field warning track to end the rally in the seventh.
Pre-Game Insights: The Giants were pushing for a wild-card spot and were trying to win one-run games.
Grant McCray mentioned that the team was just trying to get these games, just trying to win these one-run games as much as they can.
Post-Match Reflections: Giants manager Bob Melvin said that the team was fortunate to get on a guy quickly like Yastrzemski, who's really good, and kind of put pressure on him early in the inning.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Brewers' Blake Perkins has four homer-preventing catches this season.
Chourio's 449-foot homer was the longest by any Brewer this season.
The Giants played their fourth straight one-run game, going 2-2 during that stretch.
Others: LHP Kyle Harrison pitches for the Giants on Wednesday.
RHP Freddy Peralta starts for the Brewers when this three-game series continues Wednesday.
